summary: A preservation letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Google, Inc., directing the company to preserve content and information associated with three specified Gmail accounts for 90 days as part of an ongoing investigation. The letter requests non-disclosure to the account subscribers.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the preservation letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, directing Google to preserve account information.

events.title: Preservation Letter Issued to Google
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a letter to Google, Inc., directing the preservation of content and information from three specified Gmail accounts for 90 days as part of an ongoing investigation.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a preservation letter to Google on December 12, 2018, as part of an ongoing investigation.
The letter directs Google to preserve all content and information associated with three specified Gmail accounts for 90 days.
The letter requests that Google not disclose the existence of the letter to the account subscribers or others, to avoid compromising the investigation.
The letter cites 18 U.S.C. ยง 2703(f)(1) as the legal authority for the preservation request.
